user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_for_upgrade:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_for_upgrade (MHD_UpgradeHandler upgrade_handler,
                                 void *upgrade_handler_cls)
{
  struct MHD_Response *response;

  if (NULL == upgrade_handler)
    return NULL; /* invalid request */
  response = MHD_calloc_ (1, sizeof (struct MHD_Response));
  if (NULL == response)
    return NULL;
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  if (! MHD_mutex_init_ (&response->mutex))
  {
    free (response);
    return NULL;
  }
#endif
  response->upgrade_handler = upgrade_handler;
  response->upgrade_handler_cls = upgrade_handler_cls;
  response->total_size = 0;
  response->reference_count = 1;
  if (MHD_NO ==
      MHD_add_response_header (response,
                               MHD_HTTP_HEADER_CONNECTION,
                               "Upgrade"))
  {
    MHD_destroy_response (response);
    return NULL;
  }
  return response;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No unreachable code was detected in the provided function. Reasoning:
- All conditional returns (NULL checks after the upgrade_handler and after allocation) are legitimate early exits; code following them is reachable when those checks pass.
- The thread-initialization block is guarded by a preprocessor condition (#if defined(...)). When that block is compiled in it contains a reachable failure path (free(response); return NULL;). When it is not compiled in, those statements are not present — they are not unreachable code in the built translation unit.
- The call to MHD_add_response_header() is a runtime call whose return value determines the subsequent branch; there is no statically-unreachable branch in the translation unit itself.
- There are no statements after the final return, no unused labels, no #if 0 blocks, nor any constant conditions that make a branch impossible at compile time in the shown code.

Given these points, there are no code fragments in this function that appear to be statically unreachable and in need of investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
